qa_pair.question: is thier a difference in the fluke 87 and the 87-v
qa_pair.answer: The Fluke 87V is suppose to have better measurement functions than the Fluke 87. It also is one of the first meters designed to accurately measure adjustable speed drives. Both meters are true RMS meters, and both are very good quality meters from a great company that will last you a lifetime if taken care of.

qa_pair.question: is thier a difference in the fluke 87 and the 87-v

For me, the 87V's ability to measure temperature is of utmost importance. But some enjoy the Hi-Res mode of the 87V even more.

qa_pair.question: is thier a difference in the fluke 87 and the 87-v
qa_pair.answer: Differences between the Fluke 87, 87-III, and 87-V are technical and better investigated using Google, esp. regarding the GSM problem. (BTW, the 87-IV is a 187, i.e., rather a different topic)

qa_pair.question: is thier a difference in the fluke 87 and the 87-v
qa_pair.answer: 87 is the model number and the five (v) represents the version. In other words there was also an 87-2, 87-3 etc. 87-v is the current model.

qa_pair.question: as far a loudness, how loud would it be compared to the flowmaster super 10 series?
qa_pair.answer: The MBRP has a jet engine sound - constant flow of air.  It's not overtly loud.  It's throaty, and you can hear the turbo nicely.  I didn't want an extremely loud exhaust, just one that alleviated back pressure as well as having a good sound.  It does this for sure.  It's comparable to the Flowmaster.  A side note - the MBRP doesn't come with a catalytic converter.  You will have to get that separately, or keep the old one you cut out and use it for emissions.

qa_pair.question: can you use this tool AS IS to presurize a cylinder to change vavle springs on an engine?
qa_pair.answer: Yes, But you really do not need the whole gauge. Use the end of a cylinder compression tester that screws into the spark plug hole. The other end that the gauge goes on, plug your air line into. If you use the Gauges, just turn your Regulator all the way up so you get Max. Pressure in the cylinder Chamber.Pressurize cylinder with both valves closed AND Piston at the Top of the Cylinder.If you loose pressure the piston will keep the valve from falling all the way down into the Cylinder.

qa_pair.question: can you use this tool AS IS to presurize a cylinder to change vavle springs on an engine?
qa_pair.answer: I believe you can use this tool to hold the valve closed while removing the valve spring if you unlock the valve stem keepers first.  I do it all of the time and use 100 PSI of air pressure.  The piston has to be at bottom dead center.  You can also remove the spark plug, insert a flexible rope  (cloth drying rope) in the cylinder when the piston is at the bottom of the stroke, rotate the crankshaft to squeeze together near top dead center to hold the valve up while the valve spring is taken off and put back on.  It takes longer this way but you do not need the tool or air pressure.

qa_pair.question: can you use this tool AS IS to presurize a cylinder to change vavle springs on an engine?
qa_pair.answer: Yes.  You will want to remove the pushrods before pressurizing the cylinder, so that the valves will be closed.  I would also bring each cylinder to the top dead center position and lock the crankshaft so that it won't turn.  This is extra insurance just in case you loose air pressure in the cylinder for some reason, the valve(s) won't fall into the cylinder.

qa_pair.question: can you use this tool AS IS to presurize a cylinder to change vavle springs on an engine?
qa_pair.answer: Sorry to say I have no idea. I got it to do a leak down test on a 3 cylinder outboard motor. Kind of new to all this. I know on my little 50HP engine I had to lock down the flywheel so it wouldn't push the cylinders back off of top dead center. It was hard to keep the pistons from moving with a socket and breaker bar with just 30 psi in one cylinder, so I had to lock the flywheel down so I could do the leak test at 90psi.

qa_pair.question: can you use this tool AS IS to presurize a cylinder to change vavle springs on an engine?
qa_pair.answer: No. This tool only checks leakage of cylinders with supplied shop air. I don't think there is such a tool that pressurizes a cylinder to change valve springs.

qa_pair.question: How does this tester help determine between head gasket leaking and cracked block?   R.J. Gizzi's review seems to point to this ability.
qa_pair.answer: Blows shop compressor air through testing cylinder. air in the oil dipstick = bad rings, air in the radiator or seeing bubbles in the radiator = bad head gasket, air in the intake = bad intake valve, air in the exhaust pipe = bad exhaust valve. air coming from the side of the block = you're screwed, get a new car lol

rewrite.edit: The cylinder leakage tester blows shop compressor air through testing cylinder to tell you what is going bad on your car.

You must look at how the air blows in the compressor when testing, If there is air in the oil dipstick then it is a bad ring, if it bubbles then it is a bad head gasket. If there is air in the intake then it is a bad valve. If there is a leak in the exhaust pipe then it is a bqad exhaust valve.

qa_pair.question: How does this tester help determine between head gasket leaking and cracked block?   R.J. Gizzi's review seems to point to this ability.
qa_pair.answer:
I'll assume that we're talking about a water-cooled gas engine here.  Differentiating between a blown head gasket and a cracked block may be difficult because both can leak air into the cooling system, the crankcase, or directly out of the engine.  If the engine had a crack in the cylinder wall (highly unlikely), you would have a lot of blowby and heavy oil consumption.  A crack somewhere on the block deck would act just like a blown head gasket; I can't think of any way to differentiate between those two conditions.  You may have to look for other clues, like coolant in the oil (looks like chocolate milk), oil in the coolant, or either fluid on the engine exterior.  If this is a diagnosis for repair, you're going to have to pull the head anyway; if this is a pre-buy inspection I would just assume the worst.  Perhaps R. J. has some better advice.

qa_pair.question: does this unit recover recycle recharge?

qa_pair.question: does this unit recover recycle recharge?
qa_pair.answer: It does filter the refrigerant before it sends it to the storage tank, via the inline desiccant filter that comes with the OTC RG3000.  In that sense it does 'recycle' the refrigerant.  This is the same the the large 'all in one' machines do, it's just that those machines have everything (vacuum, desiccant filter, oil separator, storage for recovery tank, and scale) all contained in one big unit, which can be wheeled/moved around.  But those large machines are much more difficult to load in and out of a work/service van.

qa_pair.question: is that it can charge the battery for inverter?
qa_pair.answer: Short answer is Yes. The charger will not overcharge your battery and will maintain it at full charge. However, if you have a high amp hour battery, the recovery time after power is restored may be quite long. This charger will provide about 15 amp hours per hour of charge time if the inverter is off. For example, a 100 amp hour battery that has discharged down to the drop out voltage will take over 7 hours to fully recharge to the float voltage.

qa_pair.question: How well does this charger work in extreme cold weather?

qa_pair.question: How much Amps is this supposed to feed into battery during the "recondition/ desulfate" mode?
qa_pair.answer: It adjusts the input automatically, the main thing is that the input current oscillates on and off at a very fast rate, which loosens the lead sulfate from the plates.  Some might go back into solution, but whatever doesn't drops to the bottom of the case, hopefully below the plates.

If so, repeat the process").

qa_pair.question: Can it desulfate? Can it charge deep-cycle batteries heavily discharged to 10V?
qa_pair.answer: I am not an auto-mechanic. I purchased this charger to charge a 12V Marine-grade battery. The battery was completely "dead" but was only a year old. It charged the battery, which is now going on 5 years old and STILL re-charging on only the standard charge. I hope that helps answer your question.

qa_pair.question: Is this the correct kit for a 2005 Chevy Trailblazer EXT 4.2l 4X4?
qa_pair.answer: Yes it should be. You can decode your vin through a GM dealer to confirm. This kit works amazing !!. You must follow the instructions exactly !!. Do not over size hole recommendations !!!. Take time and read it several times !!. The servo in the side of the trans is a tricky unit to remove and re install !! It would be recommended that you remove the transmission mount to lower the unit to help with removal. CAUTION !! YOU MAY NEED TO LOOSEN FAN SHROULD SO THE FAN DOES NOT HIT SHROULD !! USE COMMEN SENCE AND DO NOT RISK DAMAGING THE FAY, SHROULD, OR RADIATOR !!

qa_pair.question: Does it constantly keep on impacting like an air impact gun like a machine gun or does it wind up every few seconds and then gives one big bang?
qa_pair.answer: It starts to impact when there is resistance, until the bolt loosens, then just spins. When tightening it spins until the bolt starts to tighten, then impacts until the desired the desired torque is applied. It basically works the same as an air impact gun.

rewrite.edit: The product works exactly like an impact gun. Once the product starts to feel some resistance there is an impact, until the bolt loosens which makes it spin until there is a tightening of the bolt.
Before the bolt loosens, the product will impact. After loosening, it should spin more. You will need to tighten it again until you reach the desired torque.
There is impact on the item when there is resistance met. The bolt will then loosen and spin. This item works similar to an air impact gun.

qa_pair.question: Does it constantly keep on impacting like an air impact gun like a machine gun or does it wind up every few seconds and then gives one big bang?
qa_pair.answer: When taking a bolt or nut off, it only impacts to unlose the bolt then whizzes it off. When tightening, it whizzes the nut or bolt on and once the nut or bolt is tight it keeps on impacting until the tightening capacity of the wrench is met.

qa_pair.question: Does it constantly keep on impacting like an air impact gun like a machine gun or does it wind up every few seconds and then gives one big bang?
qa_pair.answer: If you are loosening a bolt, it winds first. But it impacts continuously after that. Once the bolt is tight it makes a loud click sound. When it is loosening a tight bolt it will wind and click for a while until the bolt loosens. It's a nice tool, although it's noisy and a bit heavy.

qa_pair.answer: I would be careful buying this heater.  I still have not installed it because of the complexity.  It is universal and could be installed in a wide range of vehicles, but you need to be sure that you can tap into your engine block coolant drain plug and then have the space to mount the heater on your fire wall. qa_pair.question: would this work on a freash water cooled chevy 350 boat engine
qa_pair.answer: do you mean fresh water as in the lake water?  if so it wont work.  you need a closed cooling system so that the water/coolant can circulate, like a car.  most boats cool with lake water, it pumps it from the lake, thru the engine and dumps it back into the lake.  this heater wouldn't do any good

qa_pair.question: would this work on a freash water cooled chevy 350 boat engine
qa_pair.answer: If you mean fresh (raw) water cooled (as in lake to boat motor then back to lake), then no. The coolant (water) must move through a closed motor-heater-motor circuit in order to get warm enough to heat-up the oil/block.

They are mounted just touching the rear of the fender flares around the wheel well. You may not have holes to mount the small flares. I did not use the small flares on my 98. It already has plastic molding that runs between the flares.

qa_pair.question: where exactly do the small flare extentions go. No paper work came in the box. Would it have been to difficult to put L & R stickers on the rears?
qa_pair.answer: The small flare extentions mount behind the front flare, in front of the doors at the bottom of the body and I had better luck installing these first.  The shape of the rear flares tends to flare out a little more at the rear of the flare.  Hope this helped.  Also, keep these flares protected with a UV protectant.  The tend to turn grey to white without the UV protection. Hope this helps.

summary: The kit will fit Wranglers from the year 1997 to 2006, even the unlimited. The flares are three inches wider than factory flares. It will keep the interior of the vehicle dry when it's raining and you hit a puddle. It should be placed behind the front fenders, below and forward of the door. The flare kit doesn't come with all the hardware, but you can order  it separately.

qa_pair.question: What is the difference between equal-i-zer orginal 4 point hitch and equal-i-zer e2 wd hitch
qa_pair.answer: Equalizer is the 4 point sway control and the E2 is Fastway and is 2 point sway control. Both the same company just different names.

rewrite.edit: The equalizer is the 4 point sway control and the E2 is 2 point. They both are the same company, just called something different.
The difference between Equalizer and Equalizer E2 is that the Equalizer is the 4 point sway control and the E2 is Fastway and is 2 point sway control.
The Equalizer original 4-point hitch is the 4 point sway control, and the E2 WD Hitch is Fastway and is 2 point sway control.

qa_pair.question: What is the difference between equal-i-zer orginal 4 point hitch and equal-i-zer e2 wd hitch
qa_pair.answer: The original 4 point hitch has 4 friction points to reduce sway, 2 points at the trailer brackets and 2 points at the hitch head. The e2 only has 2 points of friction at the trailer brackets. The 4 point hitch will reduce sway better than the 2 point. Both will distribute the weight the same.

qa_pair.question: What is the difference between equal-i-zer orginal 4 point hitch and equal-i-zer e2 wd hitch
qa_pair.answer: I believe the e2 is more of an economy hitch compared to the equalizer 4 point and it isn't manufactured in the us like the equalizer.   With that said the e2 may not be as good in emergency situations.   I have a 1000/10000 equalizer used on a jayco 23b with 1/2 ton silverado and it is very good tow experience.

qa_pair.question: What is the difference between equal-i-zer orginal 4 point hitch and equal-i-zer e2 wd hitch
qa_pair.answer: The 4 point hitch has four spots that provide resistance against sway while the E2 has two spots.  They both have spots where the bars rest on the L- brackets ( instead of chains).  The original has two additional spots of resistance at the other end of the bars (the hitch head).  From what I've seen and read they're made by different companies - both excellent in my opinion.  For a weight distributing hitch I choose the equalizer original for the presumably more sway control.

qa_pair.question: What is the difference between equal-i-zer orginal 4 point hitch and equal-i-zer e2 wd hitch
qa_pair.answer: The 4 point hitch controls both sway (left and right motion) and dolphin (up and down motion), where the 2 point hitch only controls sway.

qa_pair.question: Will this product operate a C-pap machine ?
qa_pair.answer: Hello, A C-pap machine is used to help you breath while you sleep. To operate it remotely, as in overnight camping or similar activity, you would want to figure out an average 8 hour night's sleep power requirement for the C-pap machine. In this example, IF your C-papa machine operates at 100 watts, the EL2601 inverter would be more than ample. The battery that you would want to have already, fully charged, would be a large deep cycle battery. Double check the exact power requirements from the manufacturer's contact section of their business.

rewrite.edit: This unit should work when operating a C-pap machine remotely in overnight camping or other activities if the settings are correct, depending on the operating wattage of the machine.

The battery that you would want to have already, fully charged, would be a large deep cycle battery. Double check the exact power requirements from the manufacturer's contact section of their business.

qa_pair.question: Will this product operate a C-pap machine ?
qa_pair.answer: I've used it with mine. It's a ResMed S9. Get a deep cycle marine / RV battery because a regular battery is not designed for this type of continuous use.

qa_pair.question: Will this product operate a C-pap machine ?
qa_pair.answer: ResMed sells a 12 volt adapter for about $80On the rating plate it says 13 amps at 12 volts. I tested my ResMed S9 on AC using a Kill-a-Wattz device. With the humidifer set to 3.0 and taking deep breaths, it never went above 15 watts. So I would guess the DC adapter pulls about 1 amp, so it is usable with a normal 12 volt connector. And a deep cycle battery, of course. A car battery will be destroyed by this kind of low load.

qa_pair.question: Will this product operate a C-pap machine ?
qa_pair.answer: As long as the power consumption from the machine does NOT exceed 400W.  I don't think it does but just make sure.  You can look on the stickers of the machine and find out.Note that this converter is the higher end model not like the other cheaper model that do NOT have the pure sine wave output (those goes for like ~$60).

qa_pair.question: Will this product operate a C-pap machine ?
qa_pair.answer: According to one of the techs at the clinic, it should, but it depends on the demands of your c-pap machine. I don't know for how long, either. I was just concerned with short term lengths for power outages.

qa_pair.question: Will this product operate a C-pap machine ?
qa_pair.answer: It just depends on how much power the C-pap machine requires.  If it's less than 140 watts you can use the standard 12V outlet (cigarette lighter) in your car, but if you need more than 140 watts you'll have to wire the inverter directly to the battery posts which is what I did.  Then the product is rated at 400 watts.

qa_pair.question: Will this power a 3.5 cf refrigerator.  the  power consumption according to manual is voltage 115, frequency 60, current (A)  0.8  KW.h/24h is 0.67
qa_pair.answer: If the voltage is 115 and the current is 0.8 the power would be 115 Volts * 0.8 Amps = 92 Watts (Max, I left power factor = 1). The EL2601 can supply up to 400 Watts of power. Your fridge is using 23% of the 400 Watts. You will be fine.

qa_pair.question: Will this power a 3.5 cf refrigerator.  the  power consumption according to manual is voltage 115, frequency 60, current (A)  0.8  KW.h/24h is 0.67
qa_pair.answer: A KW is 1000 watts. Therefore 0.8 KW is equal to 800 watts. This is about double the capacity of the 400 watt inverter you asked about.Get a bigger inverter. 800 watts would do it, 1000 watts would give you a safety factor.

qa_pair.question: Will this power a 3.5 cf refrigerator.  the  power consumption according to manual is voltage 115, frequency 60, current (A)  0.8  KW.h/24h is 0.67
qa_pair.answer: Well, this inverter is 400W continuous/800W surge, if the voltage is 120V, this should be capable of supplying 400W/120V = 3.3 A continuous with a surge of 6.6 A. So, if I read the spec of your fridge correctly => 0.8 A (which seems low to me but I am not really sure what is typical), it should work.

qa_pair.question: How do you eliminate the opening where the sun shines through between the car visor and this product??
qa_pair.answer: Sally, there's a very simple answer. When the Polarized visor is mounted as instructed, it's on the bottom of the car visor. Pull it down from the car visor just about half-way, and then push the car visor all way forward towards the windshield (if the polarized visor was still folded up, it would actually be on top of the car visor). Then just adjust the polarized visor to your correct height by tilting it towards you or lowering the car visor a bit. There won't be any gap.

rewrite.edit: Mount the Polarized visor as instructed. To remove any gaps, pull the car visor down half-way and push it all the way forward towards the windshield. Adjust the polarized visor to your correct height by tilting it towards you or lowering the car visor.

The product is mounted on the bottom of the car visor. To block sun shine, pull it down about half-way from the car visor and push the car visor all the way forward towards the windshield. Take note if the visor is folded, it would be on top of the car visor. Then adjust the polarized visor to the correct height by tilting it or lowering the car visor.

When the polarized visor is in use as instructed, pull it down and push it towards the windshield and then adjust it to your correct height to cover the gap you wish to cover so there isn't any sun peeking through undesirably

qa_pair.question: How do you eliminate the opening where the sun shines through between the car visor and this product??
qa_pair.answer: Sally,  The way I do this is by changing the angular relationship between the car visor and the polarizing filter. I drop the car visor just enough to deploy the filter and then angle the filter to get it before my eyes but not so much as to create the gap you are talking about.  I believe if you experiment with this idea you will find it works.  But be aware this filter is not for direct sunlight relief.  Polarizing filters are for reflected light.  If you are going to drive during hours of low direct sunlight you will need a dark shade filter in addition to this products.  Mark

qa_pair.question: How do you eliminate the opening where the sun shines through between the car visor and this product??
qa_pair.answer: Hi Sally,  If the car visor is at a 90 degree angle from the roof of the car, the gap shows and sunlight comes through.  But by tilting the car visor 80-85 degree angle and with the attached visor pulled down, the gap is not seen.  Thus your eyes are not blinded by the sun.  I especially love it on those times driving into the sunset.

qa_pair.question: How do you eliminate the opening where the sun shines through between the car visor and this product??
qa_pair.answer: Sally, I can't remember exactly, so you might have to experiment with my explanation.  I removed the "visor piece" from the unit, and turned it around. I re-installed the unit, and the space you mentioned is gone.  Good Luck!  It did work for me.  Joeittle

qa_pair.answer: The 7" Hella H4 can be used as a replacement headlight in you '92 Miata. Be careful that the Hella you buy is not the one for motorcycles. qa_pair.question: Is this a good charger/jump starter for a 12v deep cell battery?
qa_pair.answer: It depends on what you are jump starting.   If it is a diesel with glow plugs, be aware that when you are using the high current tap, the charger is putting out about 17 volts and canburn up glow plugs if you turn them on while at this voltage.   It will charge the battery just fine.You may need to replace the clamps on the end of the charging cables.   They are pretty poor quality, but other than that, it should work just fine.

rewrite.edit: This all depends on what you plan to use it for. The diesel with glow plugs will depend on the high current tap, but will charge just fine. You may need clamps though.

It depends on what you are jump starting. If it is a diesel with glow plugs, be aware that when you are using the high current tap, the charger is putting out about 17 volts and canburn up glow plugs if you turn them on while at this voltage
A 12v deep battery charging depends on the type of vehicle and plugs that are on it. Replacing clamps on ends of cables might be necessary.

qa_pair.question: Will it fit on a 2010 toyota tacoma?
qa_pair.answer: As long as the load bars on the roof of the Toyota Tacoma do not exceed the length of the basket, it should fit fine. qa_pair.question: How do you empty this?
qa_pair.answer: With the tank laying flat, attach the waste hose to the Tote-N-Stor.  Place the other end of the hose in the RV Dump hole.  Hold the hose in place using your foot.  Reach down and set the tank up vertically and open the vent connection.  This will send the contents into the RV Dump.  Most dump stations have a water hose.  With everything still in place, spray the water hose into the vent hole to clean out your tank.  Obviously, gloves are recommended.

qa_pair.question: How do you empty this?

qa_pair.question: what is the difference between the dual zone & 4 zone?
qa_pair.answer: The 4-zone controller allows you to plug in additional Symtec accessories, such as a seat heater or heated vest, and vary the heat level of all (grips, thumb-warmer, and accessories) with the same controller.

qa_pair.question: what is the difference between the dual zone & 4 zone?
qa_pair.answer: I believe the four zone has additional plug ins for a heated vest or gloves or face shield.  I started with the dual zone but it failed.  I contacted Symtec and they replace it promptly.  Great customer service.

qa_pair.question: what is the difference between the dual zone & 4 zone?
qa_pair.answer: A dual-zone can control the grips and thumb separately. The 4-zone in addition van control vest or foot warmers for example.Caution! At least mine behaves this way.

And no aux zones.The four zone controller has four zones; one  each for grips and one for the thumb. It has two unused aux zones for seat heaters/ heated clothing and what not.

qa_pair.question: what is the difference between the dual zone & 4 zone?
qa_pair.answer: Dual zone will control the grips and thumb warmer included. 4 zone controller has jacks which allow you to plug in 2 additional Symtec accessories such as the Seat Warmer or Heated Vest.

qa_pair.question: What do you do when the grips wear out? Can you put other grips over the heating element or do you need to order replacemnts?
qa_pair.answer: You have to change the whole grip. You can buy just the heating element and put whatever grip you want. Then when they wear out you can replace just the grip.

rewrite.edit: When the grips wear out, you would replace the grip only and buy the heating element. The only thing that would need replaced is the grips themselves
The grips have to be changed completely but a heating element can be changed by itself.

qa_pair.question: What do you do when the grips wear out? Can you put other grips over the heating element or do you need to order replacemnts?
qa_pair.answer: On my previous ATV, I put on well over 1000 miles of good, hard riding on my Symtecs (hunting, off roading, etc), and while the grips were visibly worn (looking smooth in some places) they never wore out.  The heating elements are in the grips themselves, so you can't easily pull the rubber off; but assuming you could get enough of the rubber off to put another set over top, it would probably be fine.  They can put out so much heat you'd still feel it through the other grips.

qa_pair.question: How easy is it to install the wiring and what do you connect it to in order to gain power?
qa_pair.answer: Very easy. Just find a hot wire thats hot with the key on and goes off with the key off. You don't want the grips to stay on when the key is off...draining your battery!!!!

rewrite.edit: The installation of this product is very easy. The grips should be turned off when they key is off to avoid draining the battery when its stored

qa_pair.question: How easy is it to install the wiring and what do you connect it to in order to gain power?
qa_pair.answer: The grips were very easy to install if you follow the directions with WD40. I have a 2014 Yam Grizzly and I found power by taping into the 12 volt accessory wire, this is a key on wire. IE... when the key is on you have power when its off no power.

qa_pair.question: How easy is it to install the wiring and what do you connect it to in order to gain power?
qa_pair.answer: Find a power source that only powers up with the key on, my sportsman has a 12 volt cigarette lighter plug that I wired mine too. Wiring was easy everything is under the headlight cover.

qa_pair.question: How easy is it to install the wiring and what do you connect it to in order to gain power?
qa_pair.answer: There's plenty of videos on YouTube about how to install these. That's how I did it. Just watched videos. And as for power I used my 12V accessory wire. Its what I charge my garmin with. Just splice into the hot wire. Now pay attention its the wire that is hot when you turn the key on. And isn't hot when the key or the run switch is in the off position.

qa_pair.question: How easy is it to install the wiring and what do you connect it to in order to gain power?
qa_pair.answer: Overall installation is very easy. For my Polaris, I used the extra keyed powers wires which are available. If you don't have them, you can also tap into the auxiliary power port very easily with a small ring terminal end. You will have a good bit of extra wire to coil up. The lines between grips is long. Also, I recommend a different heat shrink for the thumb warmer, mine heated and wore through after only a few hours use.

qa_pair.question: Can u use it to jump the ignition to turn over the starter?
qa_pair.answer: You could use it to activate the solenoid to turn over the starter.  It will not flow enough power to turn the starter over as main current provider.   You hook this up to the vehicle battery and can use it to apply + voltage to whatever you can touch with the tip of the probe.

rewrite.edit: This product won't flow power to turn the starter over but it would be able to activate the strarter to help start it and could also be used to directly to the battery to apply positive voltage
The kit can be used to activate the solenoid to turn over the starter. There isn't enough juice by itself to start main current.  It can be hooked to a vehicle battery to apply voltage to start.
You can't really use it to jump the ignition, but you can use it to activate the solenoid to turn over the starter.

qa_pair.question: Can u use it to jump the ignition to turn over the starter?
qa_pair.answer: Yes you can inject the starter relay with voltage and the starter should turn over. This tool will inject ground and voltage into any 12 volt DC system

qa_pair.question: Can u use it to jump the ignition to turn over the starter?
qa_pair.answer: It has a built in 15 amp circuit breaker so a starter might be to much of a load. But the worst that could happen is the breaker trips and you reset it.

qa_pair.question: Can u use it to jump the ignition to turn over the starter?
qa_pair.answer: Yes, you can bypass a faulty ignition switch by applying +12v to the small stud on the starter solenoid. Don't try try to use the Power Probe to bypass the solenoid and jump between the large cables!

qa_pair.question: Can u use it to jump the ignition to turn over the starter?
qa_pair.answer: No, it is not designed to handle that kind of amperage. It is used for finding shorted circuits, and for powering up circuits to operate low amperage solenoids and relays and switches.On second thought, you could induce 12 volts to the ignition switch circuit to power up the solenoid, just don't use the Power Probe to bypass the solenoid.

qa_pair.question: Can u use it to jump the ignition to turn over the starter?
qa_pair.answer: yes u can but only the starter solenoid. u could probe the control wire on the solenoid directly (this would be the small wire). and apply power,or u could pull the starter relay and probe the load terminal (the wire going to the control terminal on starter solenoid) apply power & starter should spin over.

qa_pair.question: Do you have to have connet to a computer to use this tool or can it be used anywhere such as road side?
qa_pair.answer:
You don't need to connect a computer, this tool is designed to be  used on it own. It gives you more than one way to connect to the car's battery which is the source of power for it. Have in mind this tool is mainly designed to be used by professionals to troubleshoot electrical problems in car's electrical system. You need to have at least a basic idea about how the electrical system in a car is connected, what are the main parts of it and - in many cases - you need to have the wire diagram of the car you are trying to fix (which could be tricky to find for non professionals). Having said that, the tool itself is very useful if you know how to use it and it is a great Christmas gift for someone who works with cars.

qa_pair.question: Will this work with a 2003 6.0?
qa_pair.answer: The answer is yes, you will remove your FICM (fuel injection control module) from the drivers side valve cover. You should disconnect both batteries first, once you have it off the vehicle you will find a small cover on top of the unit remove the cover, once you have the cover off you will find nuts underneath they must be removed in order to separate the top and bottom of the shell after removing the perimeter screws. The two halves can be difficult sometimes even with all the screws removed. Once you have the two halves apart you will need to free the control board from the unit.

qa_pair.question: Can you use this Battery Minder to keep an electric golf carts batteries (6 of them) charged for 5 months?

qa_pair.question: Can you use this Battery Minder to keep an electric golf carts batteries (6 of them) charged for 5 months?
qa_pair.answer:
I would add to my previous comment that you would want to bring them to full charge with charger and use the BatteryMinder only as a maintainer/desulfator.  They should all be in similar condition.  If you find one 12v pairing has a lesser condition, I would suggest desulfating the pairs separately, spending more time on the weaker pair.  From what I understand, desulfating a bank in series/parallel will tend to favor the batteries that are in better condition.  You can make a Kentucky windage determination of condition by measuring resting voltage or be more precise by measuring specific gravity of each cell.

qa_pair.question: will cp9580  scanner reset ecm funcsun after they have lost them because battrey was taken out
qa_pair.answer: No,  the ecm has set functions and they aren't lost when you pull the battery. When you pull the battery, the ecm is reset to factory setting--sort of a neutral, baseline profile.   The ecm will relearn the profile of your engine management systems,  so the engine may run a bit sketchy for a bit.

rewrite.edit: The cp9580  scanner reset ecm function has set functions that aren't lost after you pull the battery. The cem is reset to factory settings like a neutral baseline profile and will relearn the profile of your engine management systems,  so the engine may run a bit sketchy for a bit.

The set functions isn't lost when the battery is taken out.  The ECM will reset to the factory setting but then it will learn the profile of your engine management system.  Your engine might run a bit rough for a little while.

The scanner has ability of retaining ecm set of functions even if you pull the battery out of the device. The device resets to defaults and has the ability of relearning your engine management system.

qa_pair.question: maint reqd warning light comes on is there is way to re set it ? or some thing to do with oil chang ?
qa_pair.answer: To reset maintenance required light on, start with the vehicle power off ensure odometer reading is on current mileage.  Holding the reset miles button down, power on the car while holding down the reset button.  You will see dashes on the odometer readout then the maintenance required light will go away.   You are done at that point.  Press Power button again to power off vehicle.

qa_pair.question: maint reqd warning light comes on is there is way to re set it ? or some thing to do with oil chang ?
qa_pair.answer: You didn't say which Toyota but most are as follows. Turn the ignition switch to the "On" position as you hold the odometer button in, but do not crank the engine. .Continue to press the odometer button until the total mileage shows on the display. . Turn the ignition off and the light will be out. Good luck! L Lee Parmeter

qa_pair.question: maint reqd warning light comes on is there is way to re set it ? or some thing to do with oil chang ?
qa_pair.answer: It means you need an oil change... to reset it (after changing your oil). Set the Odometer to ODO mode (not trip computer). Turn key off, hold down the ODO button, which turning key on... you'll see the ODO display show five dots, keep holding it until they turn to  dashes (takes about 5-10 seconds to complete), then let go, the light will be reset until the next scheduled service.

qa_pair.question: About how many ounces are in one 2 pound bottle?
qa_pair.answer: Be careful about weight ounces and liquid ounces.  They are not the same.  Metric does not have this problem with liters and grams. (Although many still use ml and mg as if they are the same? Oh well.)  Think about 1 cup of flour and 1 cup of water.  Both 8 volume ounces but neither 8 weight ounces.  It's a density thing.  Buy and use a scale for weight related ingredients.  Try to know what the recipe is looking for.  Admittedly not always clear.

rewrite.edit:
About how many ounces are in one 2 pound bottle?
Metric does not have this problem with liters and grams.

Weight and liquid ounces are different. You'll need to know what the recipe is looking for which can be unclear at times. One cup of flour and one cup of water for example are different weight wise but the same volume wise. They have different densities. You'll want to buy and use a scale for this reason.
The weight in liquid and ounces are different. The density will affect the weight of the item depending on if it is a liquid or if it is a solid.

qa_pair.question: About how many ounces are in one 2 pound bottle?
qa_pair.answer: 2 pounds is equal to 32 oz.  Remember that these are crystals, not a liquid solution, so that is 32 dry ounces (by weight), not fluid ounces (by volume).  I say this because some uses will have a recipe based on fluid ounces of a solution.  If that's what you need, you'll have to make the solution of the appropriate strength, and then measure your fluid ounces.  Please be certain you know what you are doing - this chemical is extremely dangerous if used incorrectly.

qa_pair.question: About how many ounces are in one 2 pound bottle?
qa_pair.answer: There should be 32 ounces in a two pound bottle. I assume that the weight of the bottle is not counted when one refers to a two pound bottle of Sodium Hydroxide.

qa_pair.question: What is the difference in the beads, flakes, and powder other than consistancy?
qa_pair.answer: chemically they are the same. Since the sodium hydroxide dissolves quite readily in water the delay for beads id not too great. However when the bottle is left open and the material is exposed to the moisture of the air, then the powder will be most strongly affected. Hence beads store for a longer time.

 chemically they are the same. However when the bottle is left open and the material is exposed to the moisture of the air, then the powder will be most strongly affected. Hence beads store for a longer time.yes

qa_pair.question: Is this Sodium Hydroxide 100% Lye?
qa_pair.answer: Technically, lye is specifically derived from percolating water through wood ashes, and it also contains some potassium hydroxide along with the sodium hydroxide.  This Sodium hydroxide on the other hand, is pure sodium hydroxide, without the other stuff that comes out of wood ashes.  They add the word "lye" on the label most probably for the layman to recognize what it is.  I have made soap with it and it works great.

qa_pair.question: Is this Sodium Hydroxide 100% Lye?
qa_pair.answer: No. 100% would be a "lab grade" which is sold in tiny little bottles and costs a fortune. At best, this lye is 99% pure.

qa_pair.question: so you have to add your own wheels and hitch ?? Anything else needed to make it ready for the road, lights, electric ??
qa_pair.answer: You don't really have to add anything, but if you want your load to ride more stable, then add an anti-wobble device. It will reduce the wobble where the tongue enters the hitch. qa_pair.question: how to disconet air ride light and busser from dash.
qa_pair.answer: Depends on the year of the vehicle. Earlier vehicles you will cut and tape the wire for the light . Later vehicles the light goes through the Computer and nothing can be done to put the light out. Read the Instructions for your Specific Application. The switch in the trunk Must be left ON when you are finished the installation on later models Because the switch affects the Power Steering Sensors.

rewrite.edit: The method of disconnecting the air ride light will depend on the make, year, and model of the vehicle in question. Older vehicles require the wire to be cut, whereas newer models are computerized and more difficult to adjust. Check your owner's manual, and if needed, bring the car to a professional.

To disconnect the air ride and busser from the dash, depends on the year of the car. The older ones will need the wire for the lights cut and then taped. Newer vehicles will go through a computer application and the light will remain on.

qa_pair.question: What is the difference between the 450 and 450R?
qa_pair.answer: They're for different style bars - if your bars on top are square shaped, I think you need the 450.  If its the aero shape, you'll need the 450R.

qa_pair.question: What is the difference between the 450 and 450R?
qa_pair.answer: Hi Sarah, the 450 is designed for the Thule rectangular load bars, while the 450R is specifically made to accommodate the Thule AeroBlade bars. Thanks!

qa_pair.question: What is the difference between the 450 and 450R?
qa_pair.answer: The 450R is the "Thule Rapid Crossroad Foot Pack" and the 450 is the "Thule Crossroad Railing Foot Pack". The 450R is designed to work with Thule's newer Aeroblade load bars (they shaped like an airplane wing), while the 450 is designed to work with the regular/basic square shaped Thule load bars. Both footpacks attach to the cars factory rack the same way, but the 450R won't work with square Thule load bars, and the 450 won't work with the Thule Aeroblade load bars.

qa_pair.question: Do these allow varied spacing of the crossbars when mounted on factory rails?
qa_pair.answer: Absolutely. There is a minimum distance depending on what your are attaching to the cross rails. I believe my Thule Boxter had a minimum distance of 28" or something like that. I certainly can understand why - in order to ensure you maximize the point of contact and anchoring affect with cargo on top of the vehicle. Hope that helps.

qa_pair.question: Do these allow varied spacing of the crossbars when mounted on factory rails?
qa_pair.answer: Hi Sandor. Yes, they do.  I have mine on a Jetta Sportwagen which has factory rails that aren't parallel. I can put the cross bar anywhere along the rails.  The way it works is you loosen a bolt that clamp the foot to the cross bar.  That allows the distance between the feet to change.  It's really easy to use and take on and off. I've had other systems before and this is by far the best quality and easiest to use of the group.
